text: Fabric devs - for a chaincode development project, which fabric version do you recommend? The v0.5 version from the github, or is there a Gerrit tag that can be used?

My hunch is, v0.5 could have mre un-fixed bugs than Gerrit, and we might not get much help from this community if we report issues while using v0.5. But then I'm not sure if Gerrit code has any "stable" tags or atleast closer to creating one such tag.
Any suggestions?

<@U1K5R1CP9> - there is  a new release being planned (v0.6) for later this month ( <@U0KM61BCP> ? ).   The v0.5 branch no longer exists in the github mirror.  I'd stick with working with the latest for now
Thank Gari - that's what I thought too.
Jut one more question - is HFC/NodeSDK working fine with Gerrit code? We seem to have run into issues.

are you doing `npm install hfc`  ?  I have not tried that latently against the master branch, but the SDK code in the master branch appears to be working (I have pushed a fix minor fixes and all my tests are passing)
what issues are you seeing?
Will ask my devs to post the issue here. We are almost thinking whether we should stick to v0.5 if we have to use nodeSDK. I'm sure that sould not be the case.
great- can you make sure they post to the <#C1GSVKK1U|nodesdk>   channel ?
Sure.
Also, Blumix blockchain seems to be using v0.5. If we code against Gerrit version of fabric, can we still deploy on Bluemix?

<@U0PB67X4K> <@U1K5R1CP9> : do you think that devenv documentation on reathedocs is up to date with regards to the source from which devenv is pulled? I am constantly experiencing issues when deploying devenv environment via vagrant (see logs above for details).
Does anyone experienced exact same issue as <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-246>

<@U1P1ZV6RF> - for some reason, there is no latest tagged base image. However, you can either pull the other base image tagged "x86" etc and re-tag it as "latest" or build the code and it should produce a latest image.
<@U1K5R1CP9> : do you mean line 34 in setup.sh ?
not sure about the line, but regading pulling base image.
<@U1K5R1CP9> : OK, got it, I will wait until the setup fails, log on into vagrant vm, pull the image and rename it
<@U1K5R1CP9> : do you think <http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io> is still the most relevant manual for fabric deployments and testing?

attachments.title: Hyperledger Fabric
attachments.text: Welcome to the Hyperledger fabric documentation

text: <@U28136VK8|ti678> has joined the channel

does anyone know which script actually invokes pulling docker images for hyperledger? Vagrantfile invokes setup.sh. Within setup.sh there is a reference to host.sh. However, in neither file there is an actual operation for pulling relevant images. Within vagrant-provisioned VM I've seen docker.sh which *probably* does this job but I cannot see a link between executables ran by Vagrant and this file. I am obviously missing something.
<@U281BA45N|klaus> has joined the channel
<@U281NGQEQ|benjyz> has joined the channel
<@U1P1ZV6RF>: it's all in scripts/provision.  Host.sh calls docker.sh
Iirc
Actually scratch that
That's how it used to work, now the Makefile calls docker.sh
<@U282ML8FK|gmullagu> has joined the channel
<@U282RG5ED|ericjaffe> has joined the channel
